abstract: Given two random k-ary sequences of length n, what is f(n,k), the expected length of their longest common subsequence ? This problem arises in the study of molecular evolution. We calculate f(n,k) for all k, where n n ≤ 5, and f(n,2) where n n ≤ 10. We study the limiting behaviour of n-1f(n,k) and derive upper and lower bounds on these limits for all k. Finally we estimate by MonteCarlo methods f(100,k),f(1000,2) and f(5000,2) .
